column1: Call to memory access function may overflow buffer
column2: Incorrect use of a function that accesses a memory buffer may read or write data past the end of that buffer.
column4: This 'memset' operation accesses 40 bytes but the [["destination buffer"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/host/sdp.c:82:39:82:42"]] is only 8 bytes.

column1: Comparison of narrow type with wide type in loop condition
column2: Comparisons between types of different widths in a loop condition can cause the loop to behave unexpectedly.
column4: Comparison between [["idx"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/host/sdp.c:787:74:787:76"]] of type uint8_t and [["attr_count"|"relative:///include/bluetooth/sdp.h:290:27:290:36"]] of wider type size_t.

column1: Comparison of narrow type with wide type in loop condition
column2: Comparisons between types of different widths in a loop condition can cause the loop to behave unexpectedly.
column4: Comparison between [["att_idx"|"relative:///subsys/bluetooth/host/sdp.c:472:10:472:16"]] of type uint8_t and [["attr_count"|"relative:///include/bluetooth/sdp.h:290:27:290:36"]] of wider type size_t.

column2: Implicit scaling of pointer arithmetic expressions can cause buffer overflow conditions.
column4: This pointer might have type [["bt_hci_evt_hdr"|"relative:///drivers/bluetooth/hci/h4.c:135:31:135:37"]] (size 2), but the pointer arithmetic here is done with type uint8_t * (size 1).

column2: Implicit scaling of pointer arithmetic expressions can cause buffer overflow conditions.
column4: This pointer might have type [["bt_hci_iso_hdr"|"relative:///drivers/bluetooth/hci/h4.c:121:31:121:37"]] (size 4), but the pointer arithmetic here is done with type uint8_t * (size 1).

column2: Implicit scaling of pointer arithmetic expressions can cause buffer overflow conditions.
